channel.title: Crystal Bow (Not bieng able to use without arrows) Problem
channel.description:
Hey fellas, Okay, so.
I log in.. take my my crystal bow... Use it (With no ammo in my quiver because I don't need it for the crystal bow, right? Right. I shoot someone and.... It doesn't show the animation for the arrow, nor does it range from afar, runs right up to my dude and shoots invisible arrows at him.
NOW..
When I put in ANY kind of ammo quiver into my arrow spot.. it works 100%.
I can't seem to find the problem, you think you can give me a hand?

item.title: Crystal Bow (Not bieng able to use without arrows) Problem
item.dc:creator: @WolfPK WolfPK
item.description:
@WolfPK wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:8, topic:345709”]Yes.

Change

                                                                if(client.playerEquipment[PlayerConstants.PLAYER_ARROWS] == arrowId) {

to :

if(client.playerEquipment[PlayerConstants.PLAYER_ARROWS] == arrowId && (client.playerEquipment[PlayerConstants.PLAYER_WEAPON] >= 4212 && client.playerEquipment[PlayerConstants.PLAYER_WEAPON] >= 4223)) {

That should work…[/quote]

Unfortunatly that didn’t work. Does the same thing. I login, equip my bow and it walks to the NPc and shoots invisible arrows (without the quiver)

But when I equip some arrows, it shoots normally.

So wierd…

Read full topic
item.source: Crystal Bow (Not bieng able to use without arrows) Problem

item.title: Crystal Bow (Not bieng able to use without arrows) Problem
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

Yes.

Change

                                                                if(client.playerEquipment[PlayerConstants.PLAYER_ARROWS] == arrowId) {

to :

if(client.playerEquipment[PlayerConstants.PLAYER_ARROWS] == arrowId && (client.playerEquipment[PlayerConstants.PLAYER_WEAPON] >= 4212 && client.playerEquipment[PlayerConstants.PLAYER_WEAPON] >= 4223)) {

That should work…

Read full topic

item.title: Crystal Bow (Not bieng able to use without arrows) Problem
item.dc:creator: @WolfPK WolfPK
item.description:
@WolfPK wrote:

cocoa:

probably with all of the other combat stuff?

for (int bowId : client.BOWS) { if(client.playerEquipment[PlayerConstants.PLAYER_WEAPON] == bowId) { usingBow = true; for (int arrowId : client.ARROWS) { if(client.playerEquipment[PlayerConstants.PLAYER_ARROWS] == arrowId) { usingArrows = true; client.getCombat().setUseRange(true); } } } }

Would that be it?

Read full topic

item.title: Crystal Bow (Not bieng able to use without arrows) Problem
item.dc:creator: @WolfPK WolfPK
item.description:
@WolfPK wrote:

cocoa:

No, that only checks to tell you that you’ve run out… not to shoot

oh… fudge… ,my bad man.

At least you tought me something so far ^-^

Okay so next step, is to find the area where it actually “Shoots” the arrows?

Read full topic

item.title: Crystal Bow (Not bieng able to use without arrows) Problem
item.dc:creator: @WolfPK WolfPK
item.description:
@WolfPK wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:2, topic:345709”]Find where it’s like
if(hasArrows) {

}

and make it
if(hasArrows || hasCrystalBowEquipped) {
//do crap
}

something like that[/quote]

It’s already in the code.

if(!usingArrows && usingBow && !(client.playerEquipment[3] >= 4212 && client.playerEquipment[3] <= 4223)) { client.getActionAssistant().sendMessage("You have run out of arrows!"); client.stopMovement(); return false; }

Read full topic
